body_html:
Thats right @vrv, but Titan X has had trouble with CUDA 7.5 with the login-loop issue. That's the reason I had installed 352.55. I got it resolved using the tips on http://olivernina.blogspot.com/2015/11/installing-titan-x-drivers-and-cuda-75.html

Get rid of nvidia residuals
sudo apt-get remove --purge nvidia*
Reboot and switch to terminal login with Ctrl+Alt+F1. Then download the required version of the nvidia driver (in my case 352.63)
cd ~/Downloads wget us.download.nvidia.com/XFree86/Linux-x86­_64/352.63/NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-352.63.ru­n
Then run
sudo service lightdm stop
Go to Downloads directory and change permissions to execute and run
chmod +x NVIDIA*.run
sudo ./NVIDIA*.run
